unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate working knowledge and understanding of the central concepts, skills and modes of inquiry in the discipline.
Design tasks that are engaging whilst enabling the collection of data regarding student progress towards syllabus outcomes.
Demonstrate a deep understanding of the literature and theory of learning and teaching underpinning effective pedagogy in this discipline.
Select and organise subject content and resources in ways which address student learning outcomes.
Select and evaluate of a range of resources, including ICT, that engage students in their learning.
Plan lessons and lesson sequences that align outcomes, student activities, assessment and feedback/reporting.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Workshop preparation may include completing set readings, conducting research, or, compiling resources

enrolment_rules.description: 130cp and (EDTE3880 or TEP388) or (EDST3140 and EDTE3010)

assessments.description: Students are required to undertake lesson preparation, including a report, worksheet, reflection and peer review (2500 words)
Students are required to prepare a sequence of lesson plans with accompanying worksheets and a justification (2,500 words)

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: EDTE4100 - Social Sciences in the Secondary School 1
data.description: This unit is designed for students who plan to teach Society and Culture or Legal Studies for years 11 and 12 but whose major teaching subject is in another area, such as Economics, Geography or History. The unit explores the aims, content and instructional demands of the NESA Society and Culture syllabus documents for Stage 6, and assists students to design innovative, student-centered units of work and to identify or develop appropriate teaching resources.
